abstract: The pressure induced phase transitions of crystalline Si films was studied in situ under a Berkovich probe using the Raman spectroscopy-enhanced instrumented indentation technique. The observations suggested strain and time as important parameters in the nucleation and growth of high-pressure phases and, in contrast to earlier reports, indicate that pressure release is not a precondition for transformation to high pressure phases.
authors: Yvonne B. Gerbig; Chris A. Michaels; Robert F. Cook;
keywords: Raman spectroscopy, Silicon, Phase transitions, Nanoindentation
title: In situ observations of Berkovich indentation induced phase transitions in crystalline silicon films
